[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The ATM Withdrawal System (AWS) defines requirements for secure cash withdrawals, account validation, and transaction processing while ensuring banking compliance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: AWS supports cash withdrawal, authentication, fund debiting, and ATM interface operations.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: AWS integrates with banking servers for validation and transaction handling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: AWS provides an ATM interface for withdrawal input, confirmation, and real-time transaction status updates on-screen.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: AWS runs on ATMs with cash dispensers and account verification modules.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: AWS uses REST APIs for transaction processing and balance updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: AWS ensures encrypted transactions between ATMs and banking servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: AWS optimizes real-time processing with minimal latency.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: AWS enables real-time withdrawals with automated debiting, ensuring cash availability tracking and minimizing transaction failures.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: AWS supports different ATM models and cash denominations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: AWS links to authentication, transaction logging, and fund processing.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: AWS enables withdrawals, account validation, and fund debiting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: AWS is designed for authenticated bank customers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: AWS requires account authentication and sufficient funds.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: AWS relies on ATM connectivity, banking system uptime, and regulatory limits.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Cash Withdrawal: Dispensing money upon validation.
Account Balance Validation: Checking available funds before transaction approval.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall connect to banking servers for account validation and transaction processing.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall interface with cash dispensers for withdrawal transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to initiate a withdrawal, select an account type, and specify an amount (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall validate withdrawal requests, ensuring sufficient funds and cash availability in ATM (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall debit the account upon validation and dispense the requested amount, supporting multi-currency withdrawals where applicable (REQ-FUNC-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall generate an electronic transaction receipt and log withdrawal details (REQ-PERF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive ATM interface with clear transaction prompts.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process withdrawal transactions within 5 seconds under normal banking network conditions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store transaction logs, withdrawal history, and account debits for auditing, ensuring a minimum retention period of five years in compliance with financial regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with banking security and financial transaction integrity standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall encrypt all transactions using AES-256 for data security (REQ-INTF-55).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure real-time synchronization with banking servers to maintain transaction accuracy.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Withdrawal operations, account validation, and transaction logging shall be tested.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: ATM user documentation, banking integration guides, and security policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Banking transaction standards, ATM withdrawal protocols, and financial security compliance.
